intro: Chorispora stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf chorispora, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pink or white, and they bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. Chorispora stricta is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
